snippet: The jurors, tired and eager to go home, wrangled for days, some of them badgering the lone holdout until she capitulated and found the defendant guilty.   Soon after the verdict the erstwhile dissenter, stricken by feelings of guilt, said that she...
lead_paragraph: The jurors, tired and eager to go home, wrangled for days, some of them badgering the lone holdout until she capitulated and found the defendant guilty. Soon after the verdict the erstwhile dissenter, stricken by feelings of guilt, said that she had never really agreed with the majority but that she had been bullied into silence. Ultimately, the juror said, she was worn down, and changed her decision to conform with the majority.

headline.main: California Case Puts Spotlight on Jury Coercion and Peer Pressure
